scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1231 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1231 is a star with 0.48 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.48 times its radius. It is located 90.09 light years away from the solar system.

TOI-1231 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1231 system


TOI-1231 b

TOI-1231 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1231 b is 15.407 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1231 b is 3.650 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, TOI-1231 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-1231, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-1231 - System With 1 Exoplanet
